{"document_id": "Kaggle::techmap::614bb512c349620b25443b22::linkedin_pe", "source": "linkedin_pe", "country": "PE", "company": "Compassion International", "position": "Public Relations Specialist II", "notes": "", "original": "

Compassion International is an Evangelical Christian non-profit organization with the mission to release children form poverty in Jesus name.


This position is based in Lima


**Please submit your resume/CV in English**


This experienced specialist researches, develops, maintains, and implements policies and programs that enhance the organization's reputation and relationships; this person aids in cultivating the organization's relations with the community, government and regulatory entities, employees, donors, and other key stakeholders. The specialist further coordinates and disseminates the organization's communications with news or trade media contacts through special events, public speaking, or other means used to reach defined audience and program needs as directed by the team. At this career level, the incumbent generally works independently on moderately complex public relations initiatives or as a team member on larger projects. He or she may coach other specialists.


Responsibilities


  • Acts as an advocate to raise the awareness of the needs of children. Understands Christ\u2019s mandate to protect children. Commits to and prioritizes child protection considerations in all decision-making, tasks and activities across the ministry. Abides by all behavioral expectations in Compassion\u2019s Statement of Commitment to Child Protection and Code of Conduct. Reports any concerns of abuse, neglect or exploitation of children through Compassion\u2019s internal reporting process and appropriately supports responses to incidents if they occur.
  • Promotes clear and consistent communication materials in support of the organization\u2019s communication strategies as guided.
  • Plans, develops, and publishes external communication (including press kits, press releases, annual reports, byline articles, storylines/pitch decks, web content, corporate messaging, and other PR vehicles.)
  • Prepares communication concerning the organization for the press and wider community with the purpose of enhancing relationships with all of the organization's various publics in order to generate mutual understanding, goodwill, awareness and support, as determined by the team.
  • Produces social media materials in alignment with communication projects and initiatives.
  • Provides input for the maintenance of the organization\u2019s brand, including the updating the style guide and editorial standards/policies.
  • May provide expertise to other professionals and support staff in the public relations discipline.


Culture


  • Accountable for supporting, upholding, and engaging in Compassion's core \"Cultural Behaviors\" in all internal and external communication and relationships.

 

Education


  • Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Social Communication, Journalism or related fields.


 

Experience


  • 3+ years of experience working in communications, journalism or public relations.
  • Previous experience working with Churches is desired.
  • Experience in planning and coordinating events.
  • Experience working in mass media and publics speaking in this or similar position or field.
  • Experience in planning, development and publication of external communications, such as: press releases, annual reports, stories, web content, corporate messages, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience working with Microsoft Office 2010 tools.


Languages


  • Advanced English level



Working Environment: Office \u2013 Standard Office Environment

Physical Demands: Sitting, standing, and/or walking for up to 8 hours per day

Travel Requirements: May be required to travel up to 25% of normal schedule
